course.subject: MARK
course.name: Consumer Behavior
course.description: Psychological concepts such as perception, learning and motivation, sociological concepts such as reference groups, family and culture and theories of purchase decision processes underlying consumer buying behavior.

reviews.author: Oceania
reviews.title: Nice professor, average content, fair grading
reviews.comment_content: How and why customers make purchasing decisions.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I like her teaching pace; she can finish one chapter in each lecture most of the time and also tries to include some relevant video clips to enrich the content, which is quite helpful in memorizing some key points. (She likes to show us US sitcoms lol)
She is nice and gives detailed feedback on our group project draft within a day.
But you have to pay attention in her class as a few points she mentioned are not included in the ppt so you have to jot them down.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is unclear as no grades/statistics are released for all the works.

Assignments 10%: they are quite easy
Class Participation 8%: I have an attendance rate of around 90%. She said participating in lectures is important but I didn't answer a single question for the whole semester.
Research Credit 2%: just attend two of them
Exam 30%: don't know about any statistics but I guess I got around 75%-80% after checking answers afterward.
Group Exercises 5%: have to complete short exercises with groupmates in some of the lectures. There are around 4, also not difficult.
Project Presentation 20%: I think we did okay, she kinda looked impressed when we were presenting
Project Report 20%: there is a detailed guideline provided, we just followed it
Peer Evaluation 5%: we all give each other good grades

Final grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is light for a 4-credit course.
There are two individual assignments throughout the whole semester, only have to write one to two pages, not difficult at all.
There is only one exam (30 MCs + 2 essay-type questions), and the questions are quite straightforward.
The heaviest workload is the group project. Average marketing course project, all details are in the course outline I attached.

reviews.author: 珍珠奶茶好飲
reviews.comment_content:
Learning the psychological concepts of consumers behavior which are some common senses.

- Consumer Behavior: An Overview
- Motivation, Ability and Opportunity
- Problem Recognition and Information Search
- High- and Low-Effort Judgment and Decision Making
- Post-Decision Processes
- Exposure, Attention and Perception
- Memory and Knowledge
- Attitudes based on High Effort
- Attitudes based on Low Effort
- Social Influence
- Innovations
- Symbolic Consumer Behavior
- The Dark Side of Consumer Behavior: Ethics and Social Responsibility
reviews.comment_teaching: She is quite a good professor and she always make students be involved. The lecture vibe is quite chill.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite nice. There is only one final quiz but she didn't release the marks.

Group project is really important as it weights 50% of your grade. Therefore you must contributed a lot so that you can get a nice grade in this course.

Assignment: 10%
Class Participation 8% Individual
Research Credit 2% Individual
Exam 30% Individual
Group Exercises 5% Group
Project Presentation 20% Group
Project Report 20% Group
Peer Evaluation 5%
reviews.comment_workload:
Not heavy.

As there is only one final quiz, I didn't spend much time in studying for this courses. But we hold group meetings once a week for the group project after the mid-term exam period, so I think the workload  just depends your teammates.

reviews.author: IHIEI
reviews.title: CONSUMER BEHAVIOR
reviews.comment_content: The content itself is very interesting. A mix of psychology and anthropology in a business course.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a nice professor but also goes through content very fast, you have to pay attention to keep up. Calls on a lot of people to answer random questions. Tries to make jokes in class
reviews.comment_grading:
-Attendance and Class Participation  10% Individual
-Pop Quizzes and In-class Exercises 13% Individual/ Group
-Term Test 1 25% Individual
-Term Test 2 25% Individual
-Group Project (Oral presentation and Written Report) 25% Group (peer-assessed)
-Research Participation 2% Individual
reviews.comment_workload: Assigns readings and case studies frequently

reviews.author: Hylee
reviews.comment_content:
CH.1 Consumer Behavior: An Overview
CH.2 Motivation, Ability and Opportunity
CH.3 Exposure, Attention and Perception
CH.4 Memory and Knowledge I & II
CH.5 Attitudes based on High Effort I & II
CH.6 Attitudes Based on Low Effort I & II
CH.7 Problem Recognition and Information Search
CH.8-9 High-and Low-Effort Judgment and Decision Making
CH.10 Post-Decision Processes
CH.11-14 Social Influence I, II & III
CH.15 Innovations
CH.16 Symbolic Consumer Behavior
CH.17 The Dark Side of Consumer Behavior: Ethics and Social Responsibility
reviews.comment_teaching: Personally, I really enjoyed Professor Zhou's teaching style. She was very interactive and constantly provided us with opportunities to participate in the lesson. Also, she gave a lot of useful feedback in the preparation part of the projects and was always open to discuss any problems or questions we may have after the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Assignments
8% Class Participation
2% Research Credit
30% Exam
5% Group Exercises
20% Project Presentation
20% Project Report
5% Peer Evaluation
TOTAL 100%
reviews.comment_workload:
- 1 Group Project
- 2 Individual Assignment
- 3-4 In-class Group Exercises (Finish it after watching a video and ready to submit it by the end of the lecture)

reviews.author: therock
reviews.title: Cute Prof Interesting Class
reviews.comment_content: Course covers some basic consumer behavior topics, a lot of them are refreshers + follow-ups to things we've learned in classes like MGMT2110 or MARK2120. Though the textbook goes into depth on a lot of the topics, the prof just introduces them in a relatively simple way (no need to memorize details, general understanding is more important)
reviews.comment_teaching: This is the CUTEST prof! She's so sweet, tries really hard to get us engaged and interested, and genuinely seems to care about her students and their understanding. It's clear she does her best to create a fun atmosphere for us, even if it was difficult because of the online mode (virus sem). Also, she's very intelligent and doesn't teach by just reading out slides like most every other prof I've had, so it's worthwhile to come to class (plus participation counts).
reviews.comment_grading: I can't comment on grading since I did P/F, but from what I've heard about this class it's supposed to be quite good.
reviews.comment_workload: Ok I'll be honest, I would sometimes forget about this course entirely. For the first month and a half, before the prof introduced the project properly, everything was super chill. I attended most lectures, but I didn't spend any time on this course outside of class. Even for the final exam I felt like there was no point studying (my goal was only to pass since I chose P/F grading) since most of the stuff was logic/understanding based, so I just chilled and it was fine. The only high workload part is the group project, but it's not any more than a normal SBM group project would be, so at this point you should be fine.

reviews.author: Simone.Q
reviews.title: Great professor, strict grading!
reviews.comment_content:
- psychological concepts in marketing such as perception, learning and motivation
- consumer attitude formation
- consumer decision-making process
- drivers of purchase motivation
- Fishbein multi-attribute model
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Joseph is very nice and funny in class. He delivers course material in an organized manner with occasional in-class case study and group work. He values class participation a lot and would call students to answer questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Professor is strict about attendance and has a high standard in terms of the quality of group work. Quiz results also play an important part of the grading. Compared to other marketing course taken (e.g. mark 3220), the grading is less generous.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is of adequate amount. We have 2 quiz throughout the semester (non-cumulative), as well as one big group project and corresponding presentation. We also have one assignment before quiz 1. Two people are required to form a pair and write a short essay. As for the group project, we need to analyze the consumer behavior of a certain brand and give recommendations. Some time needs to be spent when doing marketing observation/research and design/distribute questionnaire.

reviews.author: feiqorqq
reviews.comment_content: clear content which is followed by the textbook.
reviews.comment_teaching:
his voice is monotone which sometimes its hard to catch his words so you have to be concentrated in the class. There are some PowerPoint slides didn't include in the canvas so you have to attend every class.

didn't have to take any of the tutor class.
reviews.comment_grading:
the grading is good.

the midterm above mean, project, assignment and final exam didn't show the grade still got an A in the final grading.

participation is important for the grading it includes attendances, in-class excersie and answering questions.
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is fair.

there are one midterm and one final exam. The quizzes are not commutative yet each PowerPoint included a lot of details.

there is one assignment finish by two people, one group project(one report+presentation) and it starts in the middle of the semester and the requirements are clearly given which you can easily follow the guidelines.

there would be an in-class exercise for time to time. (2-3 times)

TA will help to take the attendance every class.

reviews.author: do
reviews.comment_content: very clear content which is all followed by the textbook
reviews.comment_teaching: her voice is very soft and monotone which sometimes its hard to catch her words. you need to be very concentrated in her class.
reviews.comment_grading:
the grading is fair.

got two quizzes on mean and screwed the project yet still got a B.
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is fair.

it only consists of 3 quizzes which the best two count. The quizzes are not commutative yet each powerpoint included a lot of details.

The project is a light workload. It starts in the middle of the semester and the requirements are clearly given which you can easily follow the guidelines.

There's in-class group exercises, yet as long as you have group mate attending the class, then you will be fine.

The TA will sit in lessons to help take attendance in every lesson.

reviews.author: lonelyguy
reviews.title: Must reg Rongrong!
reviews.comment_content:
Very interesting content, especially for those who love psychology. This course is about different psychological theories and applications from marketers and customers' perspectives.

Ch.1: Consumer Behavior Overview
Ch.2: Motivation, Ability, Opportunity
Ch.7: Problem Recognition and Information Research
Ch.8: High Effort Judgment and Decision Making
Ch.9: Low Effort Judgment and Decision Making
Ch.10: Post Decision Process

Ch.3: Exposure, Attention and Perception
Ch.4: Memory and Knowledge
Ch.5: Attitudes Based on High Effort
Ch.6: Attitudes Based on Low Effort

Ch.11 - 14: Social Influence
Ch.15: Innovations
Ch.16: Symbolic Consumer Behavior
Ch.17: The Dark Side of Consumer Behavior: Ethics and Social Responsibility
reviews.comment_teaching:
Rongrong is super nice and friendly. You can ask her everything, no matter academic stuff, career or even personal stuff. She is willing to chat with you!

She explains the concepts quite clearly yet you have to pay extra attention during lessons and her powerpoint slides are very simple and some theories will not use words to explain. You have to jot notes as she will explain the concepts one by one in class. The concepts are quite difficult and confusing.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very Good! She said she is usually lenient in giving grades and this is true!

Grading Components:
50% Quizzes (Best 2 out of 3)
- Quiz 1: -1 SD (Mean: 28.8, SD: 4.6)
- Quiz 2: +0.8 SD (Mean: 27.1. SD: 5.4)
- Quiz 3: +1.6 SD (Mean: 27.1, SD: 5.7)

35% Project: 83/100 (Mean: 81)
8% Class Participation: unknown
5% Group Exercise: unknown
2% Marketing Research: 2/2

Final Grade: A+ 多謝蓉蓉姐
reviews.comment_workload:
Fair workload. The quizzes are fairly difficult. All 3 quizzes have similar difficulty. They are all in MC format so no worries.

The project starts at quite a late stage of the course as the topic is related to Ch.5, so she will talk about the project at around late March. The workload of the project is okay. You need to find one industry and choose 1 brand as your focus and compare with the prototype of the industry. 12 pages report and 12 minutes presentation.

She will do 5 group exercises randomly and attendance is required.

reviews.author: Jamie
reviews.title: mark 3420
reviews.comment_content: content is relatively easy to understand but requires extensive reading to understand some concepts
reviews.comment_teaching: he likes making jokes all the time and classes are generally not boring
reviews.comment_grading:
the grading is fair but its crucial to do well on the quizzes
as well as class participation as the prof typically gives good grades to those he remembers the most (those who answers a lot of his questions in class)
reviews.comment_workload:
3 quizzes, one observational exercise and one group project
the workload is alright as with other marketing courses that have 3 quizzes during the term

reviews.author: linda
reviews.comment_content: This course explores the psychological concepts behind consumers' behaviours and implications for marketers. Content is relatively easy, especially if you have learnt psychology before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Zhou teaches well; she tries to make sure everyone understands her before moving on. Also encourages you to contribute your ideas in class, and is very accepting of any comments you have regardless of how correct/incorrect you are.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fair and it is not hard to do well in this course. The only criticism I have is we are not given any feedback about our group project, which does take up a pretty huge chunk of our grade, so there is less transparency there.
reviews.comment_workload: The group project is relatively easy but is quite time-consuming. You need to make a presentation and write a report for the project. Having good groupmates is very important and start early!

reviews.author: M_1240
reviews.title: Interactive and Interesting
reviews.comment_content:
The content is psychologically oriented. Topics include:
Memory and knowledge
Attitudes
Problem recognition
Judgment
Social influences
Consumer diversity, etc.

It will get fairly familiar if you have taken some SOSC courses.

The project:
Assess consumer behavior using the fishbein model. You will have to select 2 companies from the same industry and compare consumer attitudes and present suggestions for improvement for one of the two companies.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Rongrong makes her classes very interactive and interesting. She mainly relies on slides and videos to support her teaching.
She teaches at a good pace and tries to involve and include all students as she teaches.

She is clear with her instructions and they are always written out in the slides. She does encourage note-taking as not all the information is on the slides.

She will also keep updating you on the date and timings for the research participation exercise.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair.

Like most marketing courses, a fair portion of the grade relies on quizzes and the project and very little for research participation, in-class exercises, and class participation.

3 quizzes (best of 2 - 25% each) will be taken during the sem, each quiz tests 4-5 topics.

The project (35%) and in-class exercises are to be done in groups of 7-8.

Class participation (8%)
Research Participation exercise (2%)
In-class exercises (5%)
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not heavy unless you delay the project.

She will give you a lot of time to work on the project in class. The in-class exercises are conducted once or twice a week. They are to be finished and submitted by the end of class.

Attendance is not taken but participation in class will affect your grade. The more you speak up the better it is.

reviews.author: nicjai
reviews.comment_content: Fundamental customer behavior introduction. Immersion of various real life example
reviews.comment_teaching: Fair, easy to catch up thanks to weekly recap. Did explain concepts clearly. Most of them are easy to understand and graspe. Extensive Multi media materials are used in teaching
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading a majority of friends in the class are satisfied by the final grading. Fair grade distribution among grourp project, attendance and grading.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair workload. No regular course work. Only exam and group project. Midterm are mcs. If attended class not much hr is needed on revision.

reviews.author: 肥雞
reviews.comment_content: Actually the content is quite generally, which talks about conceptual things mostly. However, it is not that difficult and lots of cases will be discussed in class to help you understand it.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is quite funny and cute. He will ask lots of question in class and encourage discussion, which make you enjoy the lessons most of the time.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite harsh I think. Although I did have lots of revision, I still cannot get a good score in the quizzes. Unlike previous mark course, all three quizzes count towards your final grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is generally acceptable. Although you have things to be completed or submitted once a week, it is not that difficult.

reviews.author: hkust2383800844
reviews.comment_content:
Term Test 1 20%
Term Test 2 20%
Project Written Report 15%
Project Presentation 15%
Research Exercise 10%
Class Participation/ Cases/ In-class Exercises 20%
Research Participation 2%
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is nice. She is willing to share her experience with students and patient in answering students' enquirers. The learning atmosphere in class is relaxing. However, the direction given by the professor regarding the project are contradictory with the instruction stated in the course instruction and there is double standard during the presentation.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is bad mostly because the 1st term test is too hard (ambiguous questions set that assess students English ability rather than understanding towards the course content) and the 2nd term test is too easy (with many students got full marks)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload in class is very heavy as there are 2 projects in total, so time is needed to prepare for the reports and presentations.

reviews.author: uo3626
reviews.title: Bad grading, contents too easy
reviews.comment_content: Contents are too easy and repetitive with other introductory marketing courses. Not very useful.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is enthusiastic in teaching and very nice to students. She created a good learning atmosphere. Always stay behind for questions. But she always makes unclear instructions on the course outline and didn't explain clearly verbally. Sometimes double standard for the assessment gradings.
The 2 tests are terrible. First one has many mistakes and questions are not comprehendible, second one is too easy but contains out-of-syllabus topics.
reviews.comment_grading:
Term Test 1 20%
Term Test 2 20%
Project Written Report 15%
Project Presentation 15%
Research Exercise 10%
Class Participation/ Cases/ In-class Exercises 20%
Research Participation 2%

Group project requires a lot of effort, so as the research exercise, but effort didn't pay off and grade is still bad. I don't know what needs to be done in order to get a good grade in this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very heavy. You need many meetings with group mates to have a good project that stand out from the groups.
Quizzes are not too hard.  But too many projects in a course.

reviews.author: Anupras
reviews.comment_content: Content won’t be very insightful. Very interactive course but useless for those who possess previous knowledge about consumer thought process and purchase decision making. The class though is really fun and Roberta really puts in a lot of effort to make it interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: One of the better professors at UST. She really knows what she is talking about and will be more than eager to help you out if you have the smallest doubts.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair for this course although the professor is new to HKUST. The TA wil f you up if you mess with her.

2 quizzes: 20% each
Group project: 38%
Research exercise: 2%
Observational research: 5%
Attendance and Participation: 15%
reviews.comment_workload: No workload at all compared to other 4 credit courses!

reviews.author: Elisechow
reviews.comment_content: Benefited in strategies in capturing eyeballs of the crowd and motivating consumers in purchasing or employing service.
reviews.comment_teaching: Many interesting examples are shown in classes. Joseph made use of many different sources of ads to demonstrate principles. However, there are too much free time for class discussion while he did nothing.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair. Heavily based on projects which takes up 30% of the final grade. There are two exams in total which takes up 40% of the final grade. The first one is much easier than the second one.
Attendance is also required.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload apart from the term project.

reviews.author: unspecified
reviews.comment_content: Content is decent if you're into the psychology side of marketing. Covers various theories related to consumer behavior and consumer psychology. However some parts are a bit chur
reviews.comment_teaching: Rongrong is a horrible teacher. She simply reads off the lecture slides, and tries to make it engaging but ends up being a waste of time. For example, in one lesson she played an episode of Friends and Big Bang Theory (~40 minutes in total!), all for no reason at all.
reviews.comment_grading: I don't know how grading is, because she did not give back our grades for the presentation or report. I think grading was pretty good though.
reviews.comment_workload: Adequate workload. 3 quizzes, best 2 grades are chosen. Presentation and report not too difficult.

reviews.author: Harshil
reviews.title: Interesting course!
reviews.comment_content: This course links psychological concepts and applies it to the field of marketing. Although there is a lot of content, the more you progress into the course - the more interesting it gets, as you get a bigger picture of everything that goes on in the human mind and how we react to certain things. This information then allows marketers to market to humans in certain ways. Consumer behavior is a very interesting topic and this course brings full light on what it is really about.
reviews.comment_teaching: Joseph does a very good job in this course, especially when it comes to giving real-life examples of concepts we study in class. Application is an important part of any course, as it allows students to put concepts learned into action.
reviews.comment_grading: Joseph is a fair grader and assesses his students very well. Especially during the project - he is very open to ideas and takes into account all angles.
reviews.comment_workload: There were a total of 3 quizzes throughout the semester, out of which only two are counted towards your final grade (in Joseph's case) - 20% each quiz. One project report (15%) and presentation (15%) done in groups. One research exercise that is to be carried out in smaller groups of 2-3 people (10%). Class participation/cases/in-class exercises were 20%. 2 research participation points needed.

reviews.author: bello
reviews.comment_content:
Consumer Behavior: An Overview
Motivation, Ability and Opportunity
Problem Recognition and Information Search
High-and Low-Effort Judgment and Decision Making
Post-Decision Processes
Exposure, Attention and Perception
Memory and Knowledge
Attitudes based on High Effort
Attitudes Based on Low Effort
Social Influence
Innovations
Symbolic Consumer Behavior
reviews.comment_teaching: She is a very very nice professor! Clear in explaining different concepts. Uses a lot of different examples to illustrate the concepts and help us to memorize it easier. She is patient in answering different questions and being very nice to all the students! Love her so much!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments                  10%
Class Participation          8%
Research Credit              2%
Exam                             30%
Group Exercises             5%
Project Presentation      20%
Project Report               20%
Peer Evaluation              5%

She didn't show us all the detailed grading but turns out my grade is not bad.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much works to do during the whole semester. Individual assignments are easy and also the group exercises as long as you got some nice groupmates.

Make sure to start the group project earlier and really think about the topic you gonna pick because it's not easy for you to change in the middle of the project. Also, having some nice groupmates help a lot yet it's very important.

reviews.author: mei you qian
reviews.title: Really nice prof, good grading and fun class
reviews.comment_content:
Contents mostly focused on psychological concepts behind specific consumer behaviors. Relatively light compared to other subjects and you can absorb them pretty intuitively.

The prof prepared slides for each lesson and they did not have much letter on them - meaning you should take notes in class. But the lectures are generally well prepared and interesting so taking notes was not that much of  a pain to me.

There is one final exam and a group project. The final is cumulative and closed-book. The group is on using the Fishbein model to analyse one brand compared to its competitor. The project would take more time than you expect.

There are group and individual assignments throughout the semester but they are generally straightforward. They are graded so put efforts in them.
reviews.comment_teaching:
One of the best profs I had in UST. She does not rush through contents and she tries to make every concept very clear to us. Personally, I had no problem following her flow of logic and concepts in class - this is a rare find in UST.  
And she is really nice that no matter what question pops up (even dumbass ones) she would answer all of them very patiently. Although it was really hard to interact with class on zoom (yes corona sem) she put her best effort into class interaction so the class was not that dead. She also took a class photo on zoom which was cute 100 xd

If she teaches any other mark courses, I'd defo take it.
reviews.comment_grading:
I opted letter grading in corona sem (yikes) and this course actually turned out to be good.
Group projects and finals contribute the most to your final grade so make sure you ace them. Participation would also take a lot of marks, so make sure you participate in this class from the beginning of the sem - it's a fun course anyways.
I do not know what I got for any of the course components but I ended up with an unexpected A+. Good grading!
reviews.comment_workload: 0 workload until midway of the sem. Group projects are only introduced by then. However, make sure you have an idea on the project and form the group before that if you can. As the final is cumulative, make sure you know what's going on in course - otherwise you might not have time in the final projects and exams tsunami. However, as long as you keep on track with basics, this course is really light for a 4-creds.
